text:
Hmm, probably some NIS game. As Ockzopie earlier stated, Disgaea DS has infinite dungeons, and that applies to almost every single NIS game ever made. Well, the Disgaea series at least.

I'd take Soul Nomad and the World Eaters, though. I've played through both the normal and the demon path, but there's still plenty of unlockable stuff left. Plus I find it more challenging than any other NIS game I've played (and that covers approximately 90% of their current production). ^^

on subject: Yeah, Tetris would be the best game, since it will take a looong time before ever getting to "finish" it completely (i mean 999999 pts). Like, there's always a high score to beat...

Besides that, true a RPG would be best, and a very long one. My best guest would be a Disgaea game: it's almost impossible to truly max everything in this game. There's a infinite set of dungeons, and infinite items to boost (well, almost). 1000 hours easily!

text:
I think I would have to pick Disgaea: Hour of Darkness. Considering the sheer amount of leveling and random stages to fight through, combined with the impressive and massive number of characters to create and play with, I just don't think I'd ever do everything I could with it.

With games like tetris, I'd likely hit a barrier on how high I could go before it went too fast for me to keep up.  And others like Final Fantasy, there are level limits as well as only so many things you can do....
